Title: Tokio Marine & Nichido Fire Insurance Programming Contest 2025  (AtCoder Beginner Contest 402)
Name: Line Crossing
Problem Statement:
There are N equally spaced points on a circle labeled clockwise as 1,2,...,N.
There are M distinct lines, where the i-th line passes through two distinct points A_i and B_i (1 ≤ i ≤ M).
Find the number of pairs (i,j) satisfying:
- 1 ≤ i < j ≤ M, and
- the i-th and j-th lines intersect.
Constraints:
- 2 ≤ N ≤ 10^6
- 1 ≤ M ≤ 3 \times 10^{5}
- 1 ≤ A_i < B_i ≤ N (1 ≤ i ≤ M)
- (A_i,B_i) \neq (A_j,B_j) (i \neq j)
- All input values are integers.
IO Styles:
Input
The input is given from Standard Input in the following format:
N M
A_1 B_1
A_2 B_2
\vdots
A_M B_M
Output
Print the answer.

Sample Detail.explanation:
As shown in the diagram below, there are eight points and three lines on the circle.
![image](1.png)

The 1st and 2nd lines intersect. The 1st and 3rd lines do not intersect. The 2nd and 3rd lines intersect. Since the pairs (i,j)=(1,2),(2,3) satisfy the conditions, print 2.
